data.event: After the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, the city's population dropped due to increased unemployment.
The potash mine, owned by Uralkali, was the basis of the fortune of Dmitry Rybolovlev who sold his interest in 2010 to Suleyman Kerimov.
When it opened in 2007 the hole was initially 80m long, 40m wide and 200m deep.
